remarks: The sum of an integer modulo a positive integer and another integer equals the sum of the two integers modulo the positive integer if the other integer is in the lower part of the range between 0 and the positive integer.  (Contributed by AV, 30-Oct-2018.)
statement: modaddmodlo $p |- ( ( A e. ZZ /\ M e. NN ) -> ( B e. ( 0 ..^ ( M - ( A mod M ) ) ) -> ( B + ( A mod M ) ) = ( ( B + A ) mod M ) ) ) $.
